summary: This chapter emphasizes that both stable and transitional periods in a career offer unique opportunities for personal growth. Transitions allow individuals to build competencies in new skills, while stable times enable mastery of skills valued in the current era. The key is to continually elevate your capabilities to thrive in any environment. The chapter challenges conventional wisdom about career choices, urging readers to actively seek growth through change, rather than passively waiting for it to occur. Personal growth can be achieved even within seemingly stagnant companies if one remains vigilant and proactive.

slides.section_body: Your career narrative defines your growth trajectory. It is not just about another year in your current position; it’s about the skills and experiences you've gathered along the way. This narrative should inspire you to embrace opportunities.
slides.quote: What you just wrote down is your new career narrative, and it’s much richer than just another year at your company.

slides.section_body: Transitions in your career are crucial moments filled with potential for growth. They allow you to build new competencies that will elevate your career floor. Embrace these moments as necessary progress toward greater mastery.
slides.quote: Transitions are opportunities to raise the floor by building competency in new skills.

slides.section_body: During stable periods, focus on mastering the skills that are highly valued in your organization. This mastery not only protects you but also positions you to leverage your skills when the winds of change blow again.
slides.quote: In stable periods you can raise the ceiling by developing mastery in the skills that the new era values.

slides.section_title: THE VALUE OF TRACKING ERAS AND TRANSITIONS
slides.section_body: Keep a close watch on the cycles of change within your career. By recognizing when it’s time to move on from one era to another, you enhance your opportunity for continuous personal development. Staying aware prevents stagnation.
slides.quote: By tracking your eras and transitions, you can avoid lingering in any era beyond the point when you’re developing new masteries.

slides.section_body: Growth is not limited to startups; even mature companies can foster personal development. It’s essential, however, to remain proactive about your career path, seeking out opportunities for development and learning.
slides.quote: You can continue your personal growth even if you’re working in what some would describe as a boring, mature company.

slides.section_body: Do not assume that growth will occur automatically just because you are in a rapidly growing environment. Real growth requires intentional actions, and it's critical to take steps that can influence your development.
slides.quote: Don’t treat growth as a foregone conclusion.

slides.section_body: Recognize that you can influence your own growth trajectory. Take the initiative to seek out opportunities that align with your desired skills and competencies. Your future is shaped by the choices you make today.
slides.quote: Growth only comes from change, and that is something you can influence.

slides.section_body: The dynamics of your team play a critical role in your career development. Choose teams that foster change and challenge the status quo. A supportive environment can significantly enhance your growth journey.
slides.quote: What matters most is the particular team you join.

slides.section_body: Critically evaluate career opportunities presented to you. Sometimes the most glamorous options may not offer the best prospects for growth. Make informed decisions about where to invest your talents.
slides.quote: Even hypergrowth companies can have teams largely sheltered from change.

slides.section_body: Change is an essential aspect of career development. Embrace it with an open mind, and use it as a catalyst for elevating your skills and competencies. Your ability to adapt will shape your professional future.
slides.quote: Remember that change is the only constant; leverage it for personal growth.
